content: Personal data, all files and folders in the {{sectionNameFirst}} and {{sectionNameSecond}} sections of this user will be permanently deleted.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a warning message when deleting a user's profile, stating that personal files and folders will be permanently deleted from specific sections of the user's account. It appears in a dialog box where users confirm deletion, providing context for translators on the scope of data being removed.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Arabic translation uses an unspaced right-to-left joiner (RLM) before 'أقسام'. This can cause rendering issues and is unnecessary.
The use of "раздели" (sections) is somewhat awkward and could be improved for clarity and natural flow in Bulgarian. It's a direct translation, but not idiomatic.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to something like "лични данни, всички файлове и папки от {{sectionNameFirst}} и {{sectionNameSecond}} на този потребител..." or "лични данни, всички файлове и папки, съхранени в {{sectionNameFirst}} и {{sectionNameSecond}} на този потребител..."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The ellipsis (… or …) should be replaced with a standard ellipsis.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: The ellipsis is rendered incorrectly as an em-dash.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The non-breaking space before 'ja' looks awkward and might be unintentional. It's a formatting issue, potentially a copy-paste error.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the non-breaking space before 'ja'. The correct Finnish would be 'Henkilötiedot, kaikki tämän käyttäjän tiedostot ja kansiot osioissa {{sectionNameFirst}} ja {{sectionNameSecond}} poistetaan pysyvästi.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ֆայլեր' (files) is transliterated as 'files', it would be more natural and consistent to use the Armenian word throughout.
The word 'թղթապանակները' (folders) is transliterated as 'folders', it would be more natural and consistent to use the Armenian word throughout.
The Japanese translation uses 'および' which is a formal conjunction. A more natural and common conjunction for this context would be 'と'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: このユーザーの個人データ、{{sectionNameFirst}} と {{sectionNameSecond}} セクション内のすべてのファイルとフォルダは完全に削除されます。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation uses a space before "및". It should be a joining gu ( “과/와” or “및”) directly connected to the preceding word. Using a space disrupts readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 개인 데이터, 이 사용자의 {{sectionNameFirst}}및 {{sectionNameSecond}} 섹션에 있는 모든 파일 및 폴더가 영구적으로 삭제됩니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation uses 'ຂອງຜູ້ໃຊ້ນີ້' which translates to 'of this user'. While not incorrect, it feels slightly clunky and could be improved for smoother reading. Consider alternative phrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ຂໍ້ມູນສ່ວນຕົວ, ເອກະສານ ແລະ ໂຟນເດີທັງໝົດໃນພື້ນທີ່ {{sectionNameFirst}} ແລະ {{sectionNameSecond}} ຂອງຜູ້ໃຊ້ ຈະຖືກລົບຖິ້ມຖາວອນ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Latvian translation uses a non-breaking space ( ) instead of a regular space before '{{sectionNameFirst}}'. This might cause layout issues.
The non-breaking space character (nbsp) is missing after 'sekcjach'. This may cause issues with layout and readability.
The word 'ෆෝල්ඩර්' (folder) is spelled correctly, but it's good practice to ensure consistency with other translations if applicable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change needed, but verify consistency with other 'folder' translations.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'සියලු පුද්ගලික දත්ත' (all personal data) might be too literal. A more natural phrasing in Sinhala would better reflect the context of user file removal. While technically correct, it might sound a bit formal or unusual.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'පෞද්ගලික දත්ත සියල්ල' or a more contextual phrase depending on the overall tone.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovenian translation uses a non-breaking space ( ) instead of a regular space before 'in'. This can cause formatting issues.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace the non-breaking space before 'in' with a regular space: 'v oddelkih {{sectionNameFirst}} in {{sectionNameSecond}}'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation does not consistently use the same formatting for sections as the English (double curly braces).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistency with the English: "Lični podaci, sve datoteke i fascikle u odeljcima {{sectionNameFirst}} i {{sectionNameSecond}} ovog korisnika će biti trajno izbrisani."
